intro: Senecio sundbergii, commonly known as the Sundberg's groundsel, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is a perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in dense, spherical heads, typical of the daisy family. Senecio sundbergii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
